description.p: My name is Eli Nelson-Marsden. I live on the wester side of Australia and I am 16 as of writing and am currently in my final year of high school. I'm writing this as I am someone who is very hard to find and get in connact with. I want to explain my reasonings for my lack of online presents.

late twenty twenty one and early twenty twenty two, i finally deicided to delete all of my social media as i was disappointed with what i was using it for and how i felt like i was wasting my time. This is probably the second best decision i have ever made in my life. I have become more productive and ive felt happier in general i have also began working out, wheather that is the reason im happier or just a bi-product is up to you but if i never quit social media i wouldnt be doing it.

I have a love hate realtionship with politics. I find political discussion exstremly intresting, yet they nearly always fall into a mob mentally on stupidity and internet buzzwords. This occurs because Social media sites especially twitter encourages political content. Politics people angry and riled up thus keeping you on the site arguing, wasting time and not really achieving anything as after an argument people. "educational" videos i find the most egregious in the instance of wasting time, servered to you to make you think that your using your time to learn, when you just sitting there like a monkey watching a 30 second video of information that will have no relevance to you in future. (Spending your time lying on your bed just stairing at the ceiling would be a better use of you time.) I on occasion have done similar actions, but I try to keep to a minimum and hopfully not at all as i find it to be in my own arbitrary opinion to be stupid.

Social media makes you stupid and boring. Sites like facebook, twitter and instagram run on skinner box systems to make your dopamine respetors in your brain and essentially turn your brain to mush. When you feeling even the slights bit bored your first response is to grab your phone yet once you grab it you instantlly want to throw the damn thing away because you inherinty know that you shouldn't be doing it. This is cognitive dissonance.
TL;DR: Social media, Phone, Bad. It pretty sad.
